intro: Chileranthemum pyramidatum, commonly known as the pyramidal chileranthemum, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a compact, shrub-like growth habit with upright, pyramid-shaped stems. Its leaves are typically narrow and slightly hairy, while the flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a sunny to partially shaded environment.
